box2Header1: Adding additional insulation to a stony external wall, such as a Sandwich concrete element, outside existing insulation (e.g. polyurethane insulation)
box2Text1: The stone exterior wall excellently isolates sound.
box3Header1: Filling an air passage of a stony external wall with polyurethane foam
box3Text1: Slightly improves the thermal insulation of the building.
box4Header1: Adding additional insulation to a wooden external wall outside existing insulation (e.g. sheathing board)
box4Text1: Improves the thermal insulation of the building slightly by increasing insulation.
box5Header1: Adding 50mm or less of additional insulation to a wooden external wall inside existing insulation (e.g. porous fiberboard)
box5Text1: Improves the thermal insulation of the building slightly by increasing insulation.
box6Header1: Increasing the energy efficiency of a wooden external wall by changing to better insulators
box6Text1: Slightly improves the thermal insulation of the building.
box7Header1: Improving airtightness by taping leaks and holes in a vapour barrier
box7Text1: Improves thermal insulation, prevents heat leakage and reduces the feeling of draught.
